headline: Fresh Southern Peach Cobbler
description: This peach cobbler recipe makes the perfect dessert. Sweet Georgia peaches are topped with homemade biscuits creating a bubbling Southern-style peach cobbler perfect for summer nights.

video.description: This peach cobbler is as easy as it is delicious!
video.name: Fresh Southern Peach Cobbler

name: Fresh Southern Peach Cobbler
recipeIngredient: 8 fresh peaches - peeled, pitted and sliced into thin wedges
6 tablespoons unsalted butter, chilled and cut into small pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

In a large bowl, combine peaches, 1/4 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup brown sugar, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon juice, and cornstarch. Toss to coat evenly, and pour into a 2 quart baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine flour, 1/4 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup brown sugar, baking powder, and salt. Blend in butter with your fingertips, or a pastry blender, until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in water until just combined.
Remove peaches from oven, and drop spoonfuls of topping over them. Sprinkle entire cobbler with the sugar and cinnamon mixture. Bake until topping is golden, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Disgusting, too much salt. If you had put 1 tsp/tbs, it would’ve been great.

Well, yes, I made quite a few changes. First, I blanched the peaches, which made a breeze out of the peeling part. Instead of 1 tsp of lemon juice, I used the zest and juice of an entire lemon. I also sprinkled a pinch of nutmeg over the peaches, along with the Cinnamon, and then also added it to the topping. Make sure to add salt to the peaches as well as the topping. The previous comments mostly talked about it being dry, and not much taste. Hope these added tips help.
Turned out great. I just used the cobbler portion as I had a jar of peach pie filling in the pantry. Turned out great! I reckon any fruit base filling will work to make this into any fruit cobbler!
I have made this several time, we LOVE IT!
We used thawed peaches, the cobbler is on point!! I tripled the recipe to share with the neighbors!
Loved the crust for the cobbler. Use the recipe for my cherry cobbler too!
maybe a bit too sweet, so cut back to 1/3 cup for peaches and 1/3 cup for dough
Lacked flavor. Something was missing. Was very dry, I would definitely recommend adding some kind of liquid to the peaches. Peach juice or syrup. The crust was just too much.
How do you not love this?? It was a crowd pleaser for sure. Served it with cool whip. Will make again!
It was absolutely easy to make and many compliments for it!! Ice cream would have been a great addition to serving it but nonetheless, it was delicious!! I highly recommend it!
I have made this peach cobbler for my family several times. It is delicious! A huge favorite. Made the recipe as is.
It was good but the spice was overwhelming. More like a crisp than a cobbler.
This is the second time making this Peach Cobbler! The attached photo is the cobbler in the oven. It has twenty-five mire minutes to bake! It is gonna be amazing!

I did 7 peaches (bought the store out of the rest of the fresh peaches)! We get large peaches so it was more than enough. I had to double the topping and did not use all of the hot boiled water each time. I just poured enough in to make a tacky sticky mixture. We haven’t cut into it yet but it looks and smells amazing! Will update soon!
I don’t put the cinnamon or nutmeg, so it’s truly peachy and delicious.

Wonderful recipe. I used 5 peaches but didn't peel 4 of them since I didn't blanch them correctly. Regardless if they were peeled or not, the cobbler was fantastic! However, if you have anyone who has texture problems in your household, don't let the peaches go unpeeled if you use fresh peaches instead of canned or frozen---that was the only reason why one of the people here didn't like it.
This was a great recipe. I used fresh peaches which were totally awesome. We served it with frozen vanilla yogurt. It was a huge hit. I have shared this recipe with all my friends.
Came out great! Beautiful crumb on the "cake". I only had 3 large ripe peaches. I did not peel them. I noticed I was out of granulated sugar. I used powdered. Cake batter filled in.

I made this tonight it came out great. I used a bag of frozen peaches and a can of peaches It was a perfect balance not too sweet not too tart. The crust was crispy My broiler was a little bit too high and I changed my cute to black crystals so be careful

This was delicious. I think the sugar on top could be cut back if you double the recipe—which I did. I didn’t make the single batch so I can’t speak to that. Would definitely make again. The topping appears darker from the cinnamon/sugar mixture that is sprinkled on.
No it was absolute perfection , i am never using another recipe

Delicious recipe. I think there is a review that discusses peeling peaches. That is very helpful. And I did see another review where they said it was dry. Not my experience. It might be good to call out using very ripe peaches. I think that makes all the difference!!
I copied the recipe to the letter and it was absolutely delicious. A new family favourite. Thank you for sharing!
By far the best peach cobbler recipe I have made. The combination of cinnamon and nutmeg adds depth to the flavor. Once you try this recipe, you won't have to look for another :-)
Easy to make, but have not tasted it yet, so gave it 4 stars at this point.
This was my first time making peach cobbler and it was delicious. I will definitely make it again.
This peach cobbler is very delicious. I didn't have Nutmeg, so I used a bit cloves & allspice. It turned out great. Hubby loved it also!!!
I bought a basket of fresh peaches at our local farmers market. Our family enjoyed the fresh peach cobbler 💕
This was a fabulous recipe 😍 👌
Absolutely delicious with vanilla ice cream. Not too sweet, just right!
this was a fantastic cobbler. easy to make. and wonderful, mild taste
My peaches must have been big because I used a 13”x9” instead of 8”x8”. Was pretty easy to make and used up some fresh peaches we had!

Honestly I didn't even know what a cobler was. Just searched for a peach desert recipe and saw this good looking and good ratings desert. I made it and everybody loved it. Personally, I would put a bit less sugar. I'm definitely baking it again soon
Made recipe as is and it turned out very good. I really liked the cobbler, so the next time I make it, I will probalby increase the cobbler amount. Great way to use up the fresh palisade peaches!
This was so good! Not usually one for peaches but I would definitely make this again. The crust turned out perfect! next time i would add more cinnamon just for personal preference.

Decreased sugar to 1/4 brown plus 1/4 Monk Fruit with no other sugar used. Thumbs up on that one. I used very ripe seasonal fresh peaches. I've made this recipe several times now. Once with walnuts thrown in, excellent. Once with a complex spice mixture: cardamom, ginger, nutmeg, coriander, cinnamon -- very good, once with caraway and poppy seeds in the peach mixture (they would be better in the crust). I really understand the caraway flavor now -- it added a bitterness that didn't turn me off but reminded me of an old trunk. Ha! I won't use it again. Also one time I used 2 tablespoons of Chia seeds along with the cornstarch which turned the juices into more of a preserve or thick sauce. I double the topping because it's not enough especially if I have really juicy peaches. I substitute 1/4 of flour with wheat bran for more fiber. Because I lower the sugar so much, add the wheat bran, this isn't a dessert as much as a huge fruit serving. I feel it's really healthy, especially paired with cheese or cold roasted chicken.
Added a bit more White sugar to the peaches Because my peaches or not all the way right and did not taste too sweet to me
The recipe was easy to follow, can be whipped up in just a few minutes. The flavor was wonderful. Next time, I'll use a little less sugar, but that's just personal preference.

Wow! Just wow! I followed the recipe to a T and it came out great! I used the blanche and shock method and it was super simple to take the skin right off the peaches. Of course had to have it with a nice scoop of vanilla ice cream, absolute perfection.
I used no sugar added canned peaches and added a little more brown sugar to the cobbler mixture…delicious!
I used Calhoun peaches and the results turned out superb! Easy to make and results that were beyond my expectations! I highly recommend anyone who is craving peach cobbler to give this recipe a try.
I used a 9-1/2” deep pie plate and made little balls out of the dough. Came out beautiful, tasted even better and there wasn’t a bite left! AWESOME way to use fresh peaches.
My first time and I think it turned out pretty good. I used can peaches and I put crust on the bottom and top and brush the crust with butter and brown sugar.

I have made this at least 10 times since I found the recipe! Best cobbler EVER!! Because of my massive sweet tooth, I used 1/2 cup each of the sugar and brown sugar and used 1/2 cup of boiling water in the topping batter. Everyone I shared it with absolutely loved it. This one’s a keeper😋
Awesome! Used pastry flour, comes out a bit more crumbly. Family loved it!
I love this recipe, I just added vanilla extract in the peaches and used a whole stick of salted butter and skipped the salt, it gives the crust such a buttery soft finish!!!
It was easy to follow , very good instructions.
Easy and delicious.

I made this cobbler in 08/11/22 and received rave praises from everyone who ate it. Based on the pan that I used it was necessary to triple(make 3 batches of the dough mixture). Also, in order to achieve a crispy crust over the entire area,I used more boiling water to thin out the mixture for an even spread. Although the bake time is increased darkening could happen,but is easily remedied by covering loosely with aluminum foul.
I liked the recipe for the filling but altered the batter. I used 6 tablespoons butter 1 cup flour 1 cup sugar 2 tsp baking powder 3/4 cup milk 1/4 tsp salt

I loved this recipe! I used 7 huge peaches made it in a 13x9 inch deep dish pan. I only used about 1/2 of the cinnamon sugar topping as it was fully covered. Absolutely delicious! Top with vanilla ice cream or half n half! Yum!

"10 out of 10!" - that's what my husband told me when I made this for him. :) I only used 7 peaches (he'd already eaten one, haha), but it still turned out perfect. Delicious especially with some vanilla ice cream on the side.

I've made this recipe twice now, though without the spices (personal preference), and it's come out amazing and delectable both times. I had been looking for a recipe that was decidedly southern and had a cookie-ish, pie-ish top; and this is it! The last time, I sprinkled the top with just brown sugar and, oh my, was it even better - a tad crispy with that deep caramel flavor. I've been getting great local peaches, which really makes it special, since it's such a simple recipe without the spices. I recommend trying it my way once, as it lets the fruit flavor truly shine.

I was disappointed. So many people liked this recipe I chose to make it. It was not particularly quick to make. The peaches were cooked too much and I felt like there was too much sugar in the topping.

My husband is a long time fan of peach pie. This was his first taste of peach cobbler. He will never go back to pie after having this yummy treat! My only alteration to the recipe was using all organic ingredients. It makes a difference in pretty much everything.

What caught my eye was when the author said she had been experimenting a while for a good peach cobbler recipe. I’ve been looking for one for probably 15 years. I can never seem to find exactly what I want. This one is amazing my husband loves it he wants me to keep this recipe and not change any ingredients anymore!

This was phenomenal! I took it to a dinner with friends and not a crumb was left! The crust was perfect and thick. The filling was sweet and juicy without being runny. I can’t wait to make it again. Actually, I can’t wait to eat it again!
This is the best recipe. Absolutely delicious. The second time I made it, I doubled the topping and my husband REALLY loved it!

Delicious just as written! As others have mentioned, start out baking for 15 minutes instead of 30. I also think servings are off a bit- 2qt baking dish is an 8 X 8, which would be 9 servings, not 4. Thanks for this yummy dessert; it's a keeper!
This is recipe is super easy to make and tastes great!
It was delicious and so easy to make! I used some peaches that were about to go bad and it turned out great! My family loved it!!
We canned a half bushel peaches and saved out 11 peaches yummy
Fantastic best I made or tasted. I do not like crust. But this is good

My granddaughter requested peach cobbler. I’m a solid Crisp lover, so we went back and forth between making cobbler an crisp. She held out for the cobbler😊 I used this recipe, divided into four dishes for baking and sharing with family (I probably almost doubled the recipe - that’s a lot of fresh peaches!). It was wonderful 🤩 Long story short, Everone Loved it and it sure didn’t last long at our house! I am definitely using this recipe again, an again, and again…😊

So I made this last night I didn't have any nutmeg or lemon juice so I didn't use any lemon juice or any other substitute I did substitute nutmeg for allspice and this cobbler was amazing after I took the first bite my child hood came flooding back like I was 12 all over again. Thank you so much for this recipe this is going to be my go to for peach cobbler.

I was on the fence whether to make this recipe. Mainly because I've never made a cobbler with a drop batter as this one. But I figured fresh peaches deserved a new way...and it really did not disappoint. I think my only mistake was in the amount of peaches I used. Fresh Georgia peaches off the Peach Truck can be quite big compared to our store bought. This created quite a bit of juice and not quite as sweet as I expected but the top was excellent. I added a little crushed chili pepper to add some kick because my crew loves the combination of spicy and sweet. I also added fresh pecans. I took the suggestion of making a 1/2 batch more of batter which allowed me to cover the whole pan in batter. If I am to make this again with fresh peaches I will follow the recipe on thin sliced peaches. I left them larger and I don't think the sugars and spices absorbed as well as it would have had they been thinly sliced. Also because they were no thinly sliced some of the peaches still had a texture to them like half cooked peaches...not a bad thing, just not what I expected. The lack of 5 starts is really because of my own mistakes, not the batter itself. The batter...definitely a keeper.
This recipe is delicious with fresh peaches I picked off the tree !
We made it and ate it within 4 days. Now we are about to make more!
we have made this 3 times it's GREAT! the 1st time we topped with ice cream -the 2nd time whipped cream. the 3rd time we could not decide so we did both!
First time making it and it turned out perfect! Didn’t change a thing!!
I left the skin on the peaches, it is the best cobbler I have ever had. Next time I’ll cut the final application of sugar by 1/3. Highly recommend.
Absolutely wonderful! I added blueberries to the peaches … yum 😊👏

This peach cobbler tastes delicious but was very labor intensive (preparing the peaches). And it has too much liquid. Maybe the peaches need to cook longer prior to adding the topping or just needs to have more corn starch added.
My family loves this recipe! It so good by its self or with vanilla ice cream 😋
Made it tonight and it turned out awesome. Was the best I ever made
Didn't make any changes
My family totally loved this recipe! They ate it all and this included teenagers who couldn’t get enough. They re asking me to make again ASAP.

I come from the Peach Capital of Texas and I made this with fresh Parker County peaches! I doubled the topping recipe for more topping. It is the best peach cobbler I have ever tasted!!!! I will be headed to the Farmers Market for more peaches to make the filling and freeze so that we can enjoy cobbler until next peach season!
Man…… LOOK HERE this the best peach cobbler I ever had… I was looking for something sweet after we ate dinner and this was amazing give it 6 stars ‼️‼️‼️
Super easy, super yummy, couldn't stuff enough in my mouth. Thank you!
Just absolutely delicious!
Turned out great, used canned peaches plus one can of apricots. We used increased spices. Thanks!
yummy Your tongue will through a party for your mouth
Perfect

This recipe was great and a big hit with my family. They demanded I make a second one the next day. I did reduce the amount of flour to 1/2 cup for the topping and I used a an enamel coated cast iron skillet and it turned out beautifully!! I was so happy. Going to try to make it into a fudge!!
Tasted Absolutely AMAZING!!! Not to hard of a recipe to understand! Will definitely make it again the whole house loved it and the whole dish was gone! Topped with ice cream and whipped cream ❤️

Instant family hit! Used perfectly ripe fresh peaches and honestly experienced 0 issues with this recipe. 1 doubled recipe fours a 3 qt 13x9 pan to the brim. Didn’t want any waste so I turned the skins and pits into peach syrup. Will definitely make again!!
I kept the recipe exactly as it is and everyone LOVED IT! My very first time making a cobbler!

First time making cobbler, usually I make peach pie every year with my peaches. But this was simple and good. I think next time I'll try to make it with the cobbler on the bottom and poor the peaches on top. But Overall I like it. I'll make this instead of pies going forward...

I made the peaches using another recipe I came up with, but I wanted a different dough for the second batch I wanted to make. I followed it to T. It was great! The only way to not like this is if you wanted to some other texture. I appreciate the sweet, cakey texture bc I always eat cobbler a la mode so I don’t make my filling as sweet to balance. The dough is a great balance so I don’t feel the need to add anything else. It’s faster and doughier than my usual pie crust. My peaches and this dough may very well new best friends.
Loved this recipe, I used a different topping but the base of the peaches was delicious!
I’m an experienced baker and this recipe is truly one of the best tasting things I’ve ever made. Thanks!
This is the best cobbler recipe I’ve ever made. Thanks for making our family dinner a big success!!
Delicious!. Only complaint is too many peaches..next time I'm gonna use like 5.
Loved it! My family enjoyed it very much. I made it by the recipe as written. Easy and delicious. I will make it again and probably try it with different kinds of fruit.
Came out great. I doubled the topping
My son loves this recipe! It goes great with a scoop of Vanilla Bean Ice Cream!!

I made this yesterday and it is definitely my new favorite recipe! I had never added cornstarch before nor cooked peaches before but this was delicious. I added a tps of vanilla extract to the dough! will keep this recipe.
I always add vanilla, adds that special taste to any cobbler.
